marketNews.title: IHSG rose +1.05%, BVIC Clarifies Victoria Syariah Bank Divestment Value.
marketNews.content: Compilation of news for today. IHSG rose +1.05%. BVIC Clarifies Victoria Syariah Bank Divestment Value.

marketNews.title: BBNI FY24: Net Income +2.7% YoY, Below Expectation
marketNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) recorded a net income of 5.2 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-8.2% QoQ, -0% YoY). This result brought the net income for FY24 to grow to 21.5 trillion rupiah (+2.7% YoY), slightly below expectations as it reached 97.2% of the FY24F consensus estimate. BBNI's positive performance in FY24 was driven by: 1) Solid Net Interest Margin (NIM); 2) Maintained credit cost (CoC) and asset quality; and 3) Strong credit growth amidst liquidity challenges. NIM Solid, FY25 NIM Target Around 4-4.2%. Bank-only NIM in 4Q24 increased to the level of 4.5%, so FY24 NIM was at the level of 4.2% and exceeded management's FY24 guidance aiming for >4%. Management explained that the strong NIM in 4Q24 was mainly supported by the distribution of People's Business Credit (KUR). Excluding KUR, the company's core NIM was at the level of 4.2% in 4Q24. The achievement of NIM in 4Q24 was driven by a bank-only loan yield increase of about +20 bps QoQ, while the bank-only cost of fund (CoF) rose by +5 bps QoQ along with the increase in CASA and deposit CoF. BBNI management targets FY25 NIM around 4-4.2%, with expectations that NIM will tend to weaken during 1H25 before strengthening in 2H25. This expectation is based on tight liquidity projections in 1H25, before improving in 2H25. CoC and Asset Quality Maintained, FY25 CoC Target at ±1%. Bank-only CoC in 4Q24 swelled to the level of 1.5%, although CoC remained maintained at 1.1% during FY24 and in line with management's FY24 guidance aiming for ±1%. The swelling of CoC in 4Q24 was caused by: 1) additional provisions booked for the Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) group; and 2) conservative strategy by management for the MSME segment buffer. On the other hand, there was an improvement in bank-only asset quality, with Loan at Risk (LAR) decreasing to 10.3% and Gross Non-Performing Loan (NPL) maintained at the level of 2%. BBNI management targets CoC at the level of ±1% in FY25. Strong Credit Growth During 2024 Amidst Liquidity Challenges. Credit growth in FY24 reached +11.6% YoY (vs. FY23: +7.6% YoY), in accordance with management's FY24 guidance of +10-12%. BBNI management explained that the strengthening credit growth was driven by the corporate segment (+17.6% YoY), amidst the contraction of the KUR segment (-25% YoY). On the other hand, BBNI's liquidity continued to tighten, with bank-only Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) rising to 96.1% in FY24 (vs. FY23: 85.8%). BBNI management acknowledged the heavy liquidity challenge due to high SRBI yields and outstanding balances. Management explained that even with the Bank Indonesia interest rate cuts, liquidity will still be challenging. However, management believes that liquidity can be maintained through: 1) CASA growth via the Wondr application; 2) the latest revision of DHE SDA; and 3) increased minimum obligatory giro incentives. BBNI management targets credit growth in FY25 in the range of +8-10%, lower than Bank Indonesia's banking credit growth target of +11-13%. Key Takeaway. We assess BBNI's performance in FY24 as neutral. We view the NIM performance exceeding guidance as a positive aspect of BBNI's performance in 4Q24, considering NIM was a concern in BBNI's 1H24 performance. Looking ahead, the challenge in FY25 is focused more on the liquidity aspect, which can affect CoF and NIM. The upside catalysts for liquidity going forward can be driven by: 1) increased policy incentives, such as lowering minimum obligatory giro or DHE SDA; 2) lowering the benchmark interest rate; and 3) a decrease in SRBI yield and outstanding balances. For additional information, BBNI management also plans to propose a dividend payout ratio (DPR) for the 2024 fiscal year in the range of 50-60% (vs. 2023: 50%), indicating a dividend yield of about 6-7.2% based on the stock price on Wednesday (22/1) at the level of 4,790 rupiah per share.

marketNews.title: Government to exempt oil and gas exporters from new DHE SDA policy
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said on Wednesday (22/1) that the government will exempt oil and gas (migas) exporters from the new Foreign Exchange Earnings from Natural Resource Exports (DHE SDA) retention policy, considering the nature of the business in that sector. Susiwijono's statement came after the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Tuesday (21/1) that the government would revise the DHE SDA placement rule to a minimum of 100% for 1 year, which is larger and longer than the existing rule, which is a minimum of 30% for 3 months. Nevertheless, it is not known whether Susiwijono's statement implies that migas exporters will still be asked to comply with the DHE SDA rule of a minimum of 30% as currently stipulated.

marketNews.title: ExxonMobil signs MoU for Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) development and petrochemical plant
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Wednesday (22/1) that ExxonMobil Indonesia has officially signed a memorandum of understanding with the government to develop a carbon capture and storage (CCS) project and a petrochemical plant. The initial investment value of the project is estimated to reach 10 billion US dollars, with a total long-term commitment reaching 15 billion US dollars. The Deputy at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Elen Setiadi, stated that the CCS facility will be built around the Sunda-Asri Strait and is designed to store up to 3 gigatons of carbon per year. As for the petrochemical plant, the exact location is still under survey, considering the plant requires approximately 500 hectares of land with an ideal distance of no more than 100 kilometers from the CCS facility.

marketNews.title: Government is close to an agreement with Apple to lift the iPhone 16 sales ban in Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, told Bloomberg on Tuesday (21/1) that the government is close to reaching an agreement with Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) regarding an investment plan that will lift the ban on iPhone 16 sales in Indonesia. Rosan mentioned that the agreement is likely to be finalized within the next 1-2 weeks. Rosan's statement came after the Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, rejected a $1 billion investment offer from Apple in early January 2025 to build an AirTag factory and develop a developer academy in Indonesia. Agus at that time urged Apple to build an iPhone component factory in Indonesia to obtain the Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate, which is a requirement for iPhone sales in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: KPPU fines Google 202.5 billion Rupiah for unfair business practices related to Google Play Store billing system
marketNews.content: The Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) on Tuesday (21/1) ordered Google to pay a fine of 202.5 billion rupiah for unfair business practices related to its payment system service for the Google Play Store. The decision was the result of a KPPU investigation since 2022 into allegations that Google had abused its dominant position by requiring application developers in Indonesia to use Google Play Billing, which had a higher rate compared to other payment systems. If they disagreed, developers would face removal of their applications from the Google Play Store. KPPU also found that Google had charged fees of up to 30% through Google Play Billing. Responding to this, a Google spokesperson said on Wednesday (22/1) that the company would appeal the verdict.

marketNews.title: Initial investigation suggests eFishery inflated revenue by almost $600 million in 9M24
marketNews.content: Bloomberg on Tuesday (21/1) reported that an initial investigation into eFishery's financial statements estimated that the agritech start-up had inflated revenue by almost 600 million US dollars during 9M24, from an actual 157 million US dollars to 752 million US dollars. The investigation - which is supported by eFishery investors including SoftBank Group Corp. and Temasek Holdings Pte. - also found that the company recorded a net loss of 35.4 million US dollars during 9M24, compared to a net profit of 16 million US dollars reported in the financial statements to investors. Bloomberg stated that the figures in the investigation may still change as further findings emerge. Former CEO and co-founder of eFishery, Gibran Huzaifah, has not responded to requests for comment from Bloomberg regarding these findings.

marketNews.title: Incentives for Certain Natural Gas Price (HGBT) will continue, awaiting official regulation
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, on Tuesday stated that the incentives for Certain Natural Gas Price (HGBT) will continue, although the official regulation will only be announced later. Airlangga did not elaborate on the industrial sectors that will receive HGBT. Previously, the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated in early January 2025 that his team was discussing the possibility of reducing the number of HGBT incentive recipients, especially for companies that have recorded a good internal rate of return.

marketNews.title: UAE Government ready to sign MoU for 1 million social housing units, Turkey and Singapore also interested
marketNews.content: The Head of the Housing Task Force and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Tuesday (21/1) that the government will sign a memorandum of understanding for the procurement of 1 million housing units with the government of the United Arab Emirates by the end of January 2025. In addition, Hashim also claimed that investors from Turkey and Singapore are interested in building 500,000 and 100,000 units respectively. The construction of these houses is part of the government's project targeting the construction of 3 million units per year. Hashim also revealed that the investment value from Qatar for the construction of 1 million housing units announced some time ago ranges from 16-20 billion US dollars.

tickerNews.title: BVIC clarifies transaction value for divestment of Bank Victoria Syariah
tickerNews.content: Bank Victoria International (BVIC) in a clarification to the IDX denied the news in Bisnis on January 20, 2025, which stated that the transaction value for the divestment of PT Bank Victoria Syariah to Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) reached 1.06 trillion rupiah. BVIC explained that this figure is only the nominal value of all shares of PT Bank Victoria Syariah, where the company issued 1.06 billion shares with a nominal price of 1,000 rupiah per share. BVIC stated that the transaction value for the divestment of PT Bank Victoria Syariah will be published after the completion of the transaction plan. Previously, the President Director of BBTN, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said on Tuesday (21/1) that the acquisition value of PT Bank Victoria Syariah was below 1.5x its book value. Furthermore, Nixon also stated that BBTN will acquire Bank Victoria Syariah in a vacant condition - leaving only equity and state securities - so that loans and third-party funds will return to their owners and not be taken over by BBTN.

tickerNews.title: Sunarso, BBRI President Director, purchases 210,000 BBRI shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bank Rakyat Indonesia, Sunarso, purchased 210,000 BBRI shares at an average price of 4,200 rupiah per share on January 16, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 882 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Sunarso's ownership in BBRI increased from 0.0037% to 0.0039%.

tickerNews.title: SRTG opens opportunity for IPO for portfolio companies; targets $1 billion NAV contribution from one company
tickerNews.content: The Investment Director of Saratoga Investama Sedaya, Devin Wirawan, said that his party is opening the opportunity to hold an IPO on the IDX for companies in its portfolio that are currently still private. Some of these companies include cold chain logistics MGM Bosco Logistics, solar energy company Xurya Energi, Zap cosmetic clinic, and Brawijaya Hospital. Going forward, Devin mentioned that SRTG aims for one of its companies to contribute 1 billion US dollars to Net Asset Value (NAV). Devin himself mentioned that SRTG successfully tripled its NAV in the last 6 years to the level of 56 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Jonathan Tahir, Controller and Commissioner of SRAJ, buys ~16.8 million SRAJ shares
tickerNews.content: The Controller and Commissioner of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya, Jonathan Tahir, purchased approximately 16.8 million SRAJ shares at an average price of 1,880 rupiah per share on January 14, 2025, which is -19.7% lower than the closing stock price of SRAJ on the same day. The total transaction value reached approximately 31.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Jonathan Tahir's direct ownership in SRAJ increased from 0.49% to 0.63%.

tickerNews.title: SMGR cement sales volume declined in December 2024 and FY24
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia recorded a decline in cement sales volume to 3.1 million tons (-18% YoY, -12% MoM) in December 2024, worse than the industry-wide cement sales decline (excluding Semen Grobogan) of -14% YoY. This result brought SMGR's cement sales volume down to 10.3 million tons in 4Q24 (-10% YoY, +0.6% QoQ) and 38 million tons throughout 2024 (-6% YoY). The annual decline in cement sales volume in December 2024 was caused by a decrease in sales from Indonesian facilities to the level of 3 million tons (-18% YoY, -13% MoM). By segmentation, the proportion of bagged cement sales reached 69.5% in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 68.5%) and 69.8% throughout 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMKL establishes Joint Venture with Guangzhou Yi Song Paper Products Company Ltd. for paper and cardboard packaging
tickerNews.content: Satyamitra Kemas Lestari (SMKL) announced cooperation with Guangzhou Yi Song Paper Products Company Ltd. to establish a joint venture named PT Satyamitra Yisong Indonesia, which will operate in the paper and cardboard packaging and box industry. The joint venture will develop and market paper mold products in Indonesia, claimed to be able to replace Styrofoam as a container. PT Satyamitra Yisong Indonesia was established with an authorized capital of 30 billion rupiah, with SMKL holding 60% ownership.

tickerNews.title: DRMA Commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara bought and sold shares
tickerNews.content: The Commissioner of Dharma Polimetal, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, purchased 150,000 DRMA shares at an average price of 925 rupiah per share on January 20, 2025, making the total transaction value approximately 139 million rupiah. Three days earlier, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara sold 500,000 DRMA shares at an average price of 915 rupiah per share, making the total transaction value approximately 457 million rupiah. After both transactions, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara's ownership in DRMA decreased from 1.434% to 1.426%.

tickerNews.title: Majority shareholder of LOPI sold ~304 million shares for majority ownership consolidation
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Logisticplus International, PT Logisticsplus Multimoda Indonesia, sold approximately 304 million LOPI shares at an average price of 39 rupiah per share on January 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 11.9 billion rupiah and was aimed at consolidating majority ownership. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Logisticsplus Multimoda Indonesia in LOPI decreased from 27.64% to none.
